* needs a pick-axe to tunnel through walls.
* has [a head, a couple of arms, and a torso](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid").
* is [omnivorous](/wiki/Omnivore "Omnivore").
* is a dwarf.
* is an [overlord to its kind](/wiki/M2_PRINCE "M2 PRINCE").
* is female.
* is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong").
* [likes gold](/wiki/Gold_lover "Gold lover").
* likes gems.
* can pick up weapons and food.
* has [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision").
* can be seen through [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"). |                                                                                        |

- *This article is about the monster in dNetHack and notdNetHack. For the monster in NetHack and its female counterpart in other variants, see [dwarf king](/wiki/Dwarf_king "Dwarf king").*

A **dwarf queen**, h, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"). Rather than simply being a female counterpart to [dwarf kings](/wiki/Dwarf_king "Dwarf king"), the dwarf queen can cast [monster spells](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell").

A dwarf queen has a single weapon attack and will attempt one clerical monster spell per round of combat. She can cast *mass cure* spells, *protection* spells, and call other monsters on the level to you via *aggravation*.

## Generation

Randomly generated dwarf queens may generate as peaceful towards lawful characters. A [dwarf cleric](/wiki/Dwarf_cleric "Dwarf cleric") can [grow up](/wiki/Grow_up "Grow up") into a dwarf queen.

A dwarf queen may appear as the ruler of a [throne room](/wiki/Throne_room#dNetHack "Throne room") - her court can contain [dwarf lords](/wiki/Dwarf_lord "Dwarf lord"), dwarf clerics, [dwarves](/wiki/Dwarf_\(monster\) "Dwarf (monster)"), [gnomes](/wiki/Gnome_\(monster\) "Gnome (monster)"), [gnome lords](/wiki/Gnome_lord "Gnome lord"), [gnome ladies](/wiki/Gnome_lady_\(dNetHack\) "Gnome lady (dNetHack)"), [gnomish wizards](/wiki/Gnomish_wizard "Gnomish wizard"), [hobbits](/wiki/Hobbit "Hobbit"), and [leprechauns](/wiki/Leprechaun "Leprechaun").

## Strategy

A dwarf queen primarily acts in a supporting role to other monsters.

- *This page is a **[stub](/wiki/Category:Stubs "Category:Stubs")**. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by [**expanding this page**.](https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Dwarf_queen_\(dNetHack\)\&action=edit)*

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")
html:
Dwarf queen (dNetHack)

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
h dwarf queen (No tile)
Difficulty 9
Attacks Weapon 2d6 physical, Magic 2d6 clerical spell
h dwarf queen (No tile)
Difficulty 9
Attacks

Weapon 2d6 physical, Magic 2d6 clerical spell

Base level 6
Base experience 112
Speed 6
Base AC 10
Base MR 20
Alignment 6 (lawful)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 900
Nutritional value 300
Size medium
Resistances none
Resistances conveyed none

A dwarf queen:

  • can tunnel through walls.
  • needs a pick-axe to tunnel through walls.
  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • is omnivorous.
  • is a dwarf.
  • is an overlord to its kind.
  • is female.
  • is strong.
  • likes gold.
  • likes gems.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • has infravision.
  • can be seen through infravision.

This article is about the monster in dNetHack and notdNetHack. For the monster in NetHack and its female counterpart in other variants, see dwarf king.

A dwarf queen, h, is a type of monster that appears in dNetHack and notdNetHack. Rather than simply being a female counterpart to dwarf kings, the dwarf queen can cast monster spells.

A dwarf queen has a single weapon attack and will attempt one clerical monster spell per round of combat. She can cast mass cure spells, protection spells, and call other monsters on the level to you via aggravation.

Generation

Randomly generated dwarf queens may generate as peaceful towards lawful characters. A dwarf cleric can grow up into a dwarf queen.

A dwarf queen may appear as the ruler of a throne room - her court can contain dwarf lords, dwarf clerics, dwarves, gnomes, gnome lords, gnome ladies, gnomish wizards, hobbits, and leprechauns.

Strategy

A dwarf queen primarily acts in a supporting role to other monsters.

This page is a stub. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by expanding this page.

A '''dwarf queen''', {{magenta|h}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in [[dNetHack]] and [[notdNetHack]]. Rather than simply being a female counterpart to [[dwarf king]]s, the dwarf queen can cast [[monster spell]]s.

A dwarf queen has a single weapon attack and will attempt one clerical monster spell per round of combat. She can cast ''mass cure'' spells, ''protection'' spells, and call other monsters on the level to you via ''aggravation''.

==Generation==
Randomly generated dwarf queens may generate as peaceful towards lawful characters. A [[dwarf cleric]] can [[grow up]] into a dwarf queen.

A dwarf queen may appear as the ruler of a [[Throne room#dNetHack|throne room]] - her court can contain [[dwarf lord]]s, dwarf clerics, [[Dwarf (monster)|dwarves]], [[Gnome (monster)|gnomes]], [[gnome lord]]s, [[Gnome lady (dNetHack)|gnome ladies]], [[gnomish wizard]]s, [[hobbit]]s, and [[leprechaun]]s.

==Strategy==
A dwarf queen primarily acts in a supporting role to other monsters.
